alert.note: Alert for Isle of Wight; Southampton; Suffolk (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 22 at 2:46PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Isle of Wight, and southeastern Southampton Counties, the City of Franklin and the central City of Suffolk through 330 PM EDT... At 246 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles south of Franklin, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Franklin, Smithfield, Windsor, Downtown Suffolk, Holland, Suffolk, Isle Of Wight, Driver, Carrsville, Kings Fork, Zuni, Longview, Benns Church, Bethel Church, Chuckatuck, Wilroy, Lees Mill, Riverdale, Kilby and Walters. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EDT for northeastern North Carolina...and southeastern Virginia.
